content:
Ok, I m not the guru of compacting, but I will share my knowledge/experience and you've been waiting awhile. Compacting removes deleted messages from the folder, and it also rebuilds the index. A possible cause of confusion:: When a search is done. the global search uses the index, and users may rely on an older search after a message has been deleted. That is,, a search may indicate a message is present when it is not. There are millions of Thunderbird users; if messages were being deleted, even for 1% of users, there would be a massive outcry.

Regardless of our confidence in Thunderbird, as a business, I recommend daily backups because you are more likely to encounter a computer failure or a software crash or a virus infection. Having written that, many backups don't work, as evidenced from what we see here on the forum. The simplest backup that always works is this:

  1. If IMAP, do File>offline>download (to ensure all messages are on PC)
  2. ensure thunderbird is not running <== IMPORTANT
  3. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  4. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  5. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

Those are the basic mechanics, but a detailed assessment of potentially lost messages since last backup is encouraged. For your question no how to restore 'lost' messages, I do not feel that is possible, as the messages may likely have previously been deleted. Othes may see possibilities.
creator: davidsk

ImportExportTool NG NON è sviluppato da Thunderbird ma da uno sviluppatore indipendente che segue i suoi tempi e non fornisce garanzie (ovviamente). Minacciare di cambiare client considerando che sia per Thunderbird che per ImportExportTool NG non hai pagato un centesimo lascia il tempo che trova. Non ti trattiene nessuno. Buon lavoro anche a te.

content:
Hallo Bert,

Het lijkt er inderdaad op dat de automatische detectie heeft vastgesteld dat de 64-bitsversie kon worden geïnstalleerd. Op zich kan dat geen kwaad, standaard wordt namelijk de installatiemap van ESR gebruikt om de profielen correct om te kunnen zetten.

Waarschijnlijk kan de gehele map met de oude installatie verwijderd worden, maar om het zeker te weten kunt u het volgende proberen:

  1. Ga naar de bovenliggende map van de oude installatiemap (C:\Program Files)
  2. Geen de oude Thunderbird-installatiemap een andere naam (b.v. ‘Mozilla Thunderbird_OUD’)
  3. Start Thunderbird

Als Thunderbird normaal start en werkt, worden er geen bestanden uit de oude installatie gebruikt en kan de nu hernoemde map gerust worden verwijderd. Werkt Thunderbird niet goed, hernoem deze map dan weer naar de oude naam. Het is daarna wel zaak om uit te zoeken welke bestanden in die map nog gebruikt worden en deze op de juiste manier over te zetten.
creator: markh2

content: If you have settings for autoupdate set, you will receive updates with no further action. That is the default. You can check that at Settings>general and the Updates section. If you were on 138, you should now be on 139. If you were on 128.10, you should now be on 128.11.
creator: davidsk

content: Please clarify. Are you stating that messages sent from two other PCs and an Iphone do not appear in your sent folder? That could happen if one or more of the devices store sent messages locally. If the other devices all show sent messages done by the others, but none show sent messages from your PC, then your PC is storing messages locally or not at all. Check the copies&folders section of the account. I also suggest sending a test message from one of the other devices and verify which devices see the sent message.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello David, Thanks for helping out. All PCs archive copies of the IMAP messages locally. In the Copies and Folder section, I have selected the first option on all PCs.

When sending messages, automatically: Place a copy in: "Sent" Folder on:

Testing mails: Messages sent from the Iphone are not synchronised on either PC platforms. A test mail from my laptop now synchronizes with the main PC (but that is not often the case. Could it be the network???). Unfortunately, I can't test the third PC now because it is in a different place.
creator: info7288

content: If the laptop and PC are showing the message, then thunderbird is doing its thing. Network may be slow, but should eventually show the message. The phone appears to be using POP and should be checked. If true, you need to remove the POP account, and then create again in IMAP. That is, you cannot change POP to IMAP.
creator: davidsk

content: The challenge is to get Bitdefender to work with thunderbird, not thunderbird to work with Bitdefender. See if there are settings to bypass email interference. VPNs are notorious for interfering with email.

content:
First, the change is that a new monthly version is available, but only if the user requests it. The monthly version will have the latest changes and be updated more frequently. The existing extended support release (ESR) version will continue. More information is at 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel   If you are content with what you have, there is no need to take action.
creator: davidsk
